page.title: 01Introduction Page.
page.content: This block is mainly farmland and managed woodland. St.Arvans is the only village in the block. The village is just north of the town of Chepstow. Since the M4 and Severn Bridge were built in the 1970's St.Arvans has doubled in size.Many people now work in Bristol and live in the village. The village has two shops one of which is also a post-office,one pub called the Piercefield,one church,one hall,and one school.The school is 112 years old. Recently a long cave system has been discovered. It stretches right under this block from the River Wye in the east, to Itton Hill on the western edge of the block. Cavers believe that there are more tunnels and caves to be discovered.
